section.title: Getting started
section.para: This is a simple java-gnome program. As you will see in the following definition of Example GtkButton's setLabel() there's really nothing to it that you need to be worried about:
Place this code in Example.java and compile it.
This program has the drawback of not doing very much and even worse, not telling you that that's not what it's doing.
The way you fix that is by not making the call to Gtk.main() and instead just letting the program exit. Then just compile it with javac and you're on your way.
The real question is whether or not you know enough to run the program, or if you'd rather just run away screaming now.
